people.name: Briton Hadden
people.description: Briton Hadden  was the co-founder of Time magazine with his Yale classmate Henry Luce.

people.name: Anthony Burgess
people.description: John Anthony Burgess Wilson, FRSL  – who published under the pen name Anthony Burgess – was an English writer and composer.

people.name: Brad Darrach
people.description: Brad Darrach  was a journalist and film critic.  A 1942 graduate of the University of Pennsylvania, he joined Time Inc.

people.name: Kim Philby
people.description: Harold Adrian Russell "Kim" Philby  was a high-ranking member of British intelligence who worked as a double agent before defecting to the Soviet Union in 1963.

people.name: Charles Martin
people.description: Sir Charles James Martin CMG FRS FRCS  was a British scientist who did seminal work on a very wide range of topics including snake toxins, control of body temperature, plague and the way it was spread, dysentery, typhoid and paratyphoid, nutrition and vitamin deficiencies, proteins, and myxomatosis as a means of controlling rabbit populations.

people.name: Edward Victor Appleton
people.description: Sir Edward Victor Appleton GBE KCB FRS  was an English physicist.

people.name: George Boole
people.description: George Boole  was an English mathematician, educator, philosopher and logician.

people.name: Karl Taylor Compton
people.description: Karl Taylor Compton  was a prominent American physicist and president of the Massachusetts Institute of Technology  from 1930 to 1948.

people.name: Mark
people.description: There is no information available for this character.

people.name: Owen Willans Richardson
people.description: Sir Owen Willans Richardson, FRS  was a British physicist who won the Nobel Prize in Physics in 1928 for his work on thermionic emission, which led to Richardson's law.

items.name: Fellowship of the Royal Society
items.description: It is a book about Fellowship of the Royal Society. It says: Fellowship of the Royal Society  is an award and fellowship granted by the Royal Society of London to individuals the society judges to have made a: Fellowship of the Society, the oldest scientific academy in continuous existence, is a significant honour which has been awarded to many eminent scientists from history including Isaac Newton , Charles Darwin , Michael Faraday , Ernest Rutherford , Srinivasa Ramanujan , Albert Einstein , Dorothy Hodgkin , Alan Turing  and Francis Crick .   The following people are mentioned:  Charles James Martin (physiologist) Tim Berners-Lee   And the following place: Mádito

items.name: Awards and honours presented to Tim Berners-Lee
items.description: It is a list about Awards and honours presented to Tim Berners-Lee. It says: Sir Timothy John "Tim" Berners-Lee, OM, KBE, FRS, FREng, FRSA, DFBCS , also known as "TimBL", the inventor of the World Wide Web, has received a number of awards and honours.   The following people are mentioned:  Order of the Cross of Terra Mariana Albert Medal (Royal Society of Arts) Mohammed bin Rashid Knowledge Award  And the following place: Bradford

items.description: It is a photograph about وسام ألبرت.
